intro: Planchonella smithii, commonly known as the Smith's hibiscus, is a small evergreen tree native to the rainforests of northeastern Queensland, Australia. It belongs to the family Sapotaceae and is characterized by its glossy, dark green leaves and showy, fragrant yellow flowers. The plant produces small, round fruits that are typically green when mature and turn red when ripe. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in shaded, humid environments. Due to its ornamental value and ecological importance, it is sometimes cultivated in botanical gardens and conservation areas.
